connector.description: Access AWS Athena service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonAthenaClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonAthenaClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonAthenaClient.description: The AmazonAthena instance to use as the client.

camel.sink.endpoint.delay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.delay
camel.sink.endpoint.delay.description: Milliseconds before the next poll for query execution status. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionOption.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionOption
camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionOption.description: The encryption type to use when storing query results in S3. One of SSE_S3, SSE_KMS, or CSE_KMS. One of: [SSE_S3] [SSE_KMS] [CSE_KMS] [null]

camel.sink.endpoint.includeTrace.name: camel.sink.endpoint.includeTrace
camel.sink.endpoint.includeTrace.description: Include useful trace information at the beginning of queries as an SQL comment (prefixed with --).

camel.sink.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll for query execution status. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.sink.endpoint.kmsKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.kmsKey
camel.sink.endpoint.kmsKey.description: For SSE-KMS and CSE-KMS, this is the KMS key ARN or ID.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.maxAttempts.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxAttempts
camel.sink.endpoint.maxAttempts.description: Maximum number of times to attempt a query. Set to 1 to disable retries. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.sink.endpoint.maxResults.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxResults
camel.sink.endpoint.maxResults.description: Max number of results to return for the given operation (if supported by the Athena API endpoint). If not set, will use the Athena API default for the given operation.

camel.sink.endpoint.nextToken.name: camel.sink.endpoint.nextToken
camel.sink.endpoint.nextToken.description: Pagination token to use in the case where the response from the previous request was truncated.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The Athena API function to call. One of: [getQueryExecution] [getQueryResults] [listQueryExecutions] [startQueryExecution]

camel.sink.endpoint.outputLocation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.outputLocation
camel.sink.endpoint.outputLocation.description: The location in Amazon S3 where query results are stored, such as s3://path/to/query/bucket/. Ensure this value ends with a forward slash ('/').

camel.sink.endpoint.outputType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.outputType
camel.sink.endpoint.outputType.description: How query results should be returned. One of StreamList (default - return a GetQueryResultsIterable that can page through all results), SelectList (returns at most 1,000 rows at a time, plus a NextToken value as a header than can be used for manual pagination of results), S3Pointer (return an S3 path pointing to the results). One of: [StreamList] [SelectList] [S3Pointer]

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Athena client.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Athena client.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Athena client. One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.queryExecutionId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queryExecutionId
camel.sink.endpoint.queryExecutionId.description: The unique ID identifying the query execution.

camel.sink.endpoint.queryString.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queryString
camel.sink.endpoint.queryString.description: The SQL query to run. Except for simple queries, prefer setting this as the body of the Exchange or as a header using Athena2Constants.QUERY_STRING to avoid having to deal with URL encoding issues.

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which Athena client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id().

camel.sink.endpoint.resetWaitTimeoutOnRe.name: camel.sink.endpoint.resetWaitTimeoutOnRetry
camel.sink.endpoint.resetWaitTimeoutOnRe.description: Reset the waitTimeout countdown in the event of a query retry. If set to true, potential max time spent waiting for queries is equal to waitTimeout x maxAttempts. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.sink.endpoint.retry.name: camel.sink.endpoint.retry
camel.sink.endpoint.retry.description: Optional comma separated list of error types to retry the query for. Use 'retryable' to retry all retryable failure conditions (e.g. generic errors and resources exhausted), 'generic' to retry 'GENERIC_INTERNAL_ERROR' failures, 'exhausted' to retry queries that have exhausted resource limits, 'always' to always retry regardless of failure condition, or 'never' or null to never retry (default). See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more. One of: [never] [always] [retryable] [exhausted] [generic]

camel.sink.endpoint.waitTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.waitTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.waitTimeout.description: Optional max wait time in millis to wait for a successful query completion. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.sink.endpoint.workGroup.name: camel.sink.endpoint.workGroup
camel.sink.endpoint.workGroup.description: The workgroup to use for running the query.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientRequestToken.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientRequestToken
camel.sink.endpoint.clientRequestToken.description: A unique string to ensure issues queries are idempotent. It is unlikely you will need to set this.

camel.component.aws2-athena.amazonAthena.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.amazonAthenaClient
camel.component.aws2-athena.amazonAthena.description: The AmazonAthena instance to use as the client.

camel.component.aws2-athena.delay.description: Milliseconds before the next poll for query execution status. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.component.aws2-athena.kmsKey.description: For SSE-KMS and CSE-KMS, this is the KMS key ARN or ID.

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. camel.component.aws2-athena.maxResults.description: Max number of results to return for the given operation (if supported by the Athena API endpoint). If not set, will use the Athena API default for the given operation.

camel.component.aws2-athena.nextToken.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.nextToken
camel.component.aws2-athena.nextToken.description: Pagination token to use in the case where the response from the previous request was truncated.

camel.component.aws2-athena.operation.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.operation
camel.component.aws2-athena.operation.description: The Athena API function to call. One of: [getQueryExecution] [getQueryResults] [listQueryExecutions] [startQueryExecution]

camel.component.aws2-athena.outputLocati.description: The location in Amazon S3 where query results are stored, such as s3://path/to/query/bucket/. Ensure this value ends with a forward slash ('/').

One of: [StreamList] [SelectList] [S3Pointer]

camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Athena client.

camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Athena client.

camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyProtoco.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-athena.proxyProtoco.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Athena client. One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-athena.queryExecuti.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.queryExecutionId
camel.component.aws2-athena.queryExecuti.description: The unique ID identifying the query execution.

camel.component.aws2-athena.queryString.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.queryString
camel.component.aws2-athena.queryString.description: The SQL query to run. Except for simple queries, prefer setting this as the body of the Exchange or as a header using Athena2Constants.QUERY_STRING to avoid having to deal with URL encoding issues.

camel.component.aws2-athena.region.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.region
camel.component.aws2-athena.region.description: The region in which Athena client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id().

camel.component.aws2-athena.resetWaitTim.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.resetWaitTimeoutOnRetry
camel.component.aws2-athena.resetWaitTim.description: Reset the waitTimeout countdown in the event of a query retry. If set to true, potential max time spent waiting for queries is equal to waitTimeout x maxAttempts. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.component.aws2-athena.retry.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.retry
camel.component.aws2-athena.retry.description: Optional comma separated list of error types to retry the query for. Use 'retryable' to retry all retryable failure conditions (e.g. generic errors and resources exhausted), 'generic' to retry 'GENERIC_INTERNAL_ERROR' failures, 'exhausted' to retry queries that have exhausted resource limits, 'always' to always retry regardless of failure condition, or 'never' or null to never retry (default). See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more. One of: [never] [always] [retryable] [exhausted] [generic]

camel.component.aws2-athena.waitTimeout.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.waitTimeout
camel.component.aws2-athena.waitTimeout.description: Optional max wait time in millis to wait for a successful query completion. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

camel.component.aws2-athena.workGroup.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.workGroup
camel.component.aws2-athena.workGroup.description: The workgroup to use for running the query.

camel.component.aws2-athena.autowiredEna.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-athena.autowiredEna.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.aws2-athena.clientReques.name: camel.component.aws2-athena.clientRequestToken
camel.component.aws2-athena.clientReques.description: A unique string to ensure issues queries are idempotent. It is unlikely you will need to set this.
